sub_title: Communication Officer at National Coalition of NGO | Student at Erasmus University Rotterdam
summary:
Vilte Novikovaite is a young professional with experience working in non-profit organizations such as the Lithuanian Red Cross and National NGO Coalition. At the moment, she is studying at Erasmus College University, deepening her knowledge of problem-solving learning and international law. Vilte will graduate in 2025 with Liberal art and Sciences diploma. 

During her career in the Red Cross, Vilte was responsible for volunteers' team management and coordination, managing the Ukrainian crisis in Lithuania. She worked in two different departments: She was the Head of the Youths and Disaster management team. 

As the Head of the Youth Department, she organized educational activities and events for youth to increase their social awareness and self-responsibility. She also helps to build strong communicational strategies for short or long-term non-profit projects, as well as create/ edit the content of NGO messages so their communities. 

Her free time is actively spent volunteering at the paramilitary non-profit organization better known as Šiaulių sąjunga, participating in various sports extreme sports activities, as well as traveling, and writing her journey blog.

At the moment, Vilte is open to any internship opportunities related to the non-profit, law, or public policies sector in the Netherlands. Feel free to contact her!

education.field_of_study: Lycée Les Trois Sources, Valence, France

profile_positions.company: Nacionalinė NVO koalicija/ National NGO Coalition
profile_positions.title: Communications Officer

company.name: Centre For African Justice, Peace and Human Rights

profile_positions.company: Centre For African Justice, Peace and Human Rights
profile_positions.description:
It has already been a month since I started my first internship days at the Centre for African Justice, Peace and Human Rights.

You might be asking… What? Where? How? Well… As a current law major student, I knew that the only way to gain hands-on experience in fields like human rights and international public law is to find an internship where you could grow together with other inspiring legal professionals. 

What can I say… I could not be happier to join the dutch non-profit organization, the Centre for African Justice, Peace and Human Rights, which promotes justice, peace and human rights through raising awareness, capacity building, research (legal and otherwise), education, training and campaigning.

My specialized field of work — is sexual violence (SV) against the male gender. Yes, you understood right — AGAINST male gender:  our Team acknowledges that SV is experienced by all genders, but males constitute the focus of our work as in theory and practice, they are often overlooked as victims, and the field is so stigmatized that the silence and stigma surrounding this topic makes it even harder for the activist to support the victims.

Together with the Team, we conduct research (including legal research and research on the underlying causes of SV), publish magazines, and host annual conferences. I am very grateful for this exceptional opportunity, and let's see where this internship will guide me.
profile_positions.title: Intern / Legal Researcher

profile_positions.description:
◦ Coordinating 6 voluntary disaster response teams that consist of 100 trained volunteers
◦ Responsible for communication with team leaders, management of training timetables, problem-solving
on the field, and reporting to the head of the program.
◦ Conducting such training as "The management of spontaneous volunteers." and "Family evacuation plan
◦ Organizing interviews for candidate volunteers
◦ Developing field guidelines and procedures to enable the national society to implement its disaster
preparedness and response plan.
◦ Initiating dialogue with key actors to establish a well-functioning coordination mechanism in disaster
management
◦ Working with the Ukrainian refugee crisis to support the management in an organizational sense
profile_positions.title: National Disaster Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
◦ Planning and initiating youth teams that consist of 60 volunteers in every cities
◦ Сonducting meetings with the government and municipality representatives to encourage youth volunteer
involvement at the educational institution
◦ Coordinating the Red Cross School Ambassador‘s Program in the biggest Lithuanian cities;
◦ Working with schools to increase youth involvement in volunteering
◦ Creating new guidelines for the youth program
profile_positions.title: Youth Program Coordinator

volunteer_experiences.description:
Ginti, puoselėti bei mylėti savo valstybę — apie tai kalba neretas Lietuvos pilietis, tačiau žodžių neužtenka, jog užtikrintum šalies laisvę bei saugumą. Lietuvos Šaulių sąjunga suteikia galimybę įgyti bazinių karinių žinių bei nuolatos jas tobulinti karinių pratybų metu tam, jog piliečiai patys gebėtų apginti pirmiausia save bei šeimą, o vėliau ir visą tautą.

It is with my greatest appreciation to my country and nation, I fight and protect Lithuania.

company.name: Team Europe Junior Lithuania (Jaunimo Europos Komanda)

volunteer_experiences.description:
Informing young people about European Union, implementing educational lessons, conferences, and discussions about such topics as EU institutions, Brexit, environment and ecology, our future in Europe. 

Main activities:
◦ Managing social media accounts and growing Facebook page like numbers by +1000;
◦ Organizing live events on Facebook about misinformation during the COVID19 pandemic with doctors and
scientists
◦ Ensuring high standard lectures about Youth opportunities in European Union;
◦ Leading online discussions with local politicians about EU policy
